oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An innovative approach to enhance biodiversity on farmland: the credit point system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stöckli, Sibylle
Pfiffner, Lukas
Chevillat, Véronique
Jenny, Markus
Birrer, Simon
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Biodiversity and ecosystem services
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Background and objectives - Agri-environment schemes (AES) aim to reverse the decrease in farmland biodiversity. - The implemented AES did not result in a general increase in farmland biodiversity. - There is a need of innovative tools to motivate farmers to enhance biodiversity on their farms. - Objectives: (1) Develop a simple tool with which farmers can assess individual efforts for biodiversity on their farms. (2) Evaluate the effect of advisory support to optimize ecological and economical aspects for individual farms.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Stöckli, Sibylle; Pfiffner, Lukas; Chevillat, Véronique; Jenny, Markus and Birrer, Simon (2014) An innovative approach to enhance biodiversity on farmland: the credit point system. Poster at: Xth European Congress of Entmology, York, UK, 3 - 8th August 2014. [Completed]
